author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mannarmannan, son of poet Bharathidasan, and Bharathi, grandson, at the poets’ interaction session held at Vazhappadi in Salem.

A plea to set up a memorial for renowned poet Bharathidasan was made by his son Mannarmannan and grandson Bharathi.

They participated in a poets’ interaction programme held at the branch library at Vazhappadi town on Saturday.

They thanked the Chief Minister for announcing April 29, the birth anniversary of Poet Bharathidasan, as Poets’ Day.

They said that the poet stayed at Thiagaraja Nagar in Chennai when he was involved in film industry. Hence, the State Government should come forward to set up a mani mandapam for the late poet in the city.

The family members of Bharathidasan are prepared to handover all the documents regarding the poet to be kept at the memorial, they said.

Chandramohan, charter president of the Lions Club, office-bearers and members of the Literary Forum and others participated in the poets’ interaction session.

According to the organisers, more than 20 poets from Vazhappadi and surrounding areas will participate in the 125th birth anniversary of Bharathidasan proposed in Puducherry shortly.
title: Plea to set up memorial for poet Bharathidasan
